results.title: The Interview [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Craig Monahan, Bill Hughes, Interview Films and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: A haunting feature debut from Craig Monahan which explores the complex psychological exchange between Detective Sergeant John Steele (Tony Martin) and nervy suspected murderer Eddie Fleming (Hugo Weaving) during the hours of a claustrophobic police interrogation.The apparently ordinary Fleming is asleep in his apartment when his door is broken down and he is accused of nameless crimes. He is the only lead the tough, world weary Detective Sergeant Steele has and so begins a bewildering sequence of interviews where the crime and the many forces at work between the characters and their situation gradually becomes apparent. The nature of guilt, innocence and who or what to believe is rendered uncertain in this film as we are presented not with any concrete answers but with the fluidity of perception and the difficulties of defining truth. (Awards: Winner Best Original Screenplay, Best Film and Best Actor (Hugo Weaving) Australian Film Institute Awards, 1998)

results.title: Malcolm [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.brief_description: Malcolm, a simple genius played by Colin Friels, loses his job at a Melbourne tram depot after building his own one-man tram and taking to the streets. With funds dwindling, Malcolm is forced to take in a lodger, a small time criminal who moves in with girlfriend, Judith. Frank soon realizes that Malcolm’s mechanical wizardry can help his career - the result - a series of oddball but unsuccessful robberies that culminates in the heist of the decade that stretches Malcolm’s devises to the full. “Malcolm” was critically acclaimed world wide and received eight AFI Awards including best director and best film.

results.title: Muriel's Wedding [DVD]
results.creator_credit: P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and out of place girl who would give anything to be like her bitchy friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bitter-sweet and much acclaimed film which touches the essence of the themes of self-respect, identity and friendship. Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

holdings.name: DVD; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: My survival as a deviant
results.brief_description: Director Toby Zoates takes his camera to the squats of inner Sydney in an attempt to ascertain who the real deviants of society are - those who choose to do things their own way, or those that try to stop them. Utilising the cinema verite style and a punk soundtrack, he interviews a cross-section of people affected by issues such as unemployment and drugs, and examines the tactics those disenfranchised by societal pressures use to survive. This documentary, shot during Malcolm Fraser’s reign as Prime Minister, looks at the mundane reality of life for many young people, and aims to persuade viewers to take political action against a system that is seen to oppress individuality and demonise non-conformist behaviour. Filmed around Pyrmont, Kings Cross, and Chippendale.

results.title: Hotham holiday
results.brief_description: Shows Mount Hotham, Victoria as a holiday getaway - the snow fields, ski-runs; the trip from Harrietville 12 miles away; people riding horses to reach the snowline; beautiful views and natural environment. Hotham Heights is the highest meteorological station in Australia. This film was made pre “chairlifts”.

results.title: Newsfront [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Richard Brennan, David Elfick and Palm Beach Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the newsreel cameramen who lived and worked in Australia during the golden era of the newsreel from 1948 to 1956. Len Maguire is a top cameraman whose devotion to his work and loyalty to his company creates conflict with both his colleagues and the people he loves. Amy is a production assistant working in a predominantly male environment and Len’s brother, Frank, heads the Australian branch of an American newsreel company in competition with Len’s company.

results.title: The Moka festival
results.creator_credit: J. Campbell Dobbie and Peerless Films
results.brief_description: This film shows the Moka Festival which is held deep in the heart of New Guinea. The many tribes walk great distances carrying with them a live pig lashed to a pole. The pig represents a major feature of the Moka ceremony. Wealthy chiefs distribute their wealth to the less fortunate chiefs and pigs and shells are currency between the villages. The tribal people adorn themselves with paint and feathers and dance at the “festival of giving”. Photography by Arnold M. Maahs.

results.title: Looking for Alibrandi [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kate Woods, Robyn Kershaw, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Premium Movie Partnership and AFFC
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by first time writer Melina Marchetta, “Looking for Alibrandi” is an affectionate look at three generations of strong willed Italian women, and the youngest member, Josie’s (Pia Miranda) attempt to break the family “curse”. 17 year old Josie lives with her single mother Christina (Greta Scacchi), is completing her HSC at an exclusive Sydney school on a scholarship, begrudgingly visiting her Nonna, defending the labels of “wog” and “bastard”, and longing after the lifestyle afforded to rich kids with both parents. When her father, Michael (Anthony La Paglia) enters their lives again, Josie confronts her mother and her Nonna about the rift between Christina and her father, and the animosity between mother and daughter to reveal secrets long since hidden. Josie must also make decisions about her future career and what her heart desires as she is torn between school captain John Barton (Matthew Newton) and public school boy Jacob (Kick Gurry). Between work, school, family and personal relationships, Josie discovers that life is filled with uncertainty and she is not the only one debilitated by the labels society ascribes. This was the first feature film effort for both director Woods and actor Miranda. Remarkably, the film was nominated and won several AFI awards, including best film, best supporting actress (Scacchi) and best performance by an actress in a leading role (Miranda).

holdings.name: DVD; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: People (Yallourn's Royal Hour 1954; Born to Die; Sir John Monash)
results.brief_description: “Yallourn’s Royal Hour” highlights the visit to Yallourn of Queen Elizabeth II and the Duke of Edinburgh on 3rd March 1954. Film of the royal motorcade through Melbourne is shown before their arrival in Yallourn where they inspect the coal extraction site at Yallourn Cut (16 min). “Born to Die” focuses on the prospect that Yallourn will be demolished to enable access to the coal reserves beneath it. Includes comments by the townspeople on their feelings about this. (48 mins) “Sir John Monash” is a tribute to the life of this pioneer Australian. The Vice Chancellor of Monash University speaks on his life and an account of his achievements is given. (27 min)
